title: About
content: At Shiva Boys' Hindu College, our dedicated team of educators and support staff work tirelessly to provide students with a nurturing, disciplined, and enriching environment. Their passion and professionalism are at the heart of everything we do. Shiva Boys' Hindu College is dedicated to nurturing young minds through holistic education, cultural grounding, and academic excellence. We empower students to become confident leaders of tomorrow.

title: School Opened
content: Shiva Boys' Hindu College was founded on September 9th, 2000 with a vision to provide quality education grounded in tradition and values.

title: School Houses
content: Shiva Boys' Hindu College has four houses which are various representations of Lord Shiva. 1. Rudra - Strength, passion and determination. House color - Red. 2. Mahadev - Wisdom, leadership and unity. House color - Blue. 3. Trilochan - Vision, clarity and excellence. House color - Yellow. 4. Shambo - Energy, creativity and resilience. House color - Orange.

title: Departments
content: Shiva Boys' Hindu College has three departments. 1. Business/IT/Modern Studies Department. 2. Mathematics/Science Department and 3. Language Department

title: Business/IT/Modern Studies Department
content: Our Business, Information Technology & Modern Studies Department equips students with practical skills in entrepreneurship, digital literacy, and social awareness. We prepare learners to thrive in the modern world through innovative projects, critical thinking, and real-world applications. The CXC Subjects under this department are 1. Accounting, 2. Computer Science, 3. Geography, 4. Information Technology, 5. Law, 6. Management of Business, 7. Principles Of Accounts, 8. Principles of Business, 9. Social Studies, 10. Sociology

title: Mathematics/Science Department
content: The Mathematics & Science Department fosters analytical thinking, problem-solving, and curiosity about the natural world. Through hands-on experiments and logical exploration, students gain a strong foundation to innovate, investigate, and excel in STEM fields. The CXC Subjects under this department are 1. Additional Mathematics, 2. Biology, 3. Chemistry, 4. Environmental Science, 5. Integrated Science, 6. Mathematics, 7. Physical Education, 8. Physics, 9. Technical Drawing

title: Language Department
content: The Language Department promotes effective communication, cultural appreciation, and linguistic fluency. Through immersive learning experiences, students develop strong reading, writing, and speaking skills in both local and global languages. The CXC Subjects under this department are 1. Art, 2. Caribbean Studies, 3. Communication Studies, 4. English Language, 5. English Literature, 6. Music, 7. Spanish, 8. Theatre Arts

title: CXC CSEC
content: Eighteen CXC CSEC subjects which are taught to Forms one to five students at Shiva Boys' Hindu College are Additional Mathematics, Biology, Chemistry, Electronic Document Preparation and Management (EDPM), English A, English B, Geography, Information Technology, Integrated Science, Mathematics, Physical Education, Physics, Principles of Accounts (POA), Principles of Business (POB), Social Studies, Spanish, Technical Drawing (TD) and Theatre Arts

title: CXC CAPE
content: Fifteen CXC CAPE subjects which are taught to Form six students at Shiva Boys' Hindu College are Accounting, Biology, Caribbean Studies, Chemistry, Communication Studies, Computer Science, Economics, Environmental Science, Information Technology, Law, Management of Business (MOB), Pure Mathematics, Physical Education, Physics, Sociology

title: School Leadership
content: The Principal of Shiva Boys' Hindu College is Mr. Devinesh Neeranjan. The Vice Principal is Pundit Rickie Maharaj.

title: School Year
content: The academic school year of 2025/2026 consists of three academic terms. Term I consists of fifteen weeks from September 2nd, 2025 to December 12th, 2025. Term II consists of twelve weeks from January 5th, 2026 to March 27th, 2026. Term III consists of twelve weeks from April 13th, 2026 to July 3rd, 2026.

title: School Vacation
content: School vacation after Term I of 2025/2026 academic year consists of three weeks from December 13th, 2025 to January, 2026. School vacation after Term II of 2025/2026 academic year consists of two weeks from March 27th, 2026 to April 12th 2026. School vacation after Term III of 2025/2026 academic year consists of eight weeks from July 4th, 2026 to a date to be determined.
